Two new Executive Orders were issued: mandating a 14-day quarantine for road travelers arriving in Texas from Louisiana; relating to the release of individuals in county and municipal detention.

The prior Executive Order mandating self-quarantine for those arriving from the NY Tri-State Area and New Orleans is expanded to include air travelers from California, Louisiana, Washington, Atlanta, Chicago, Detroit and Miami.

The first of these sites will be the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center in Dallas. While hospitals will remain the primary location to treat and care for patients, we are ensuring Texas is prepared for any possible scenario.

Texas has doubled #COVID19 hospital bed availability this past week. The state is also working with @TXMilitary and @USACEHQ to equip locations to serve as health care facilities if additional capacity is needed.

We’re all in this together and this town hall gives Texans the opportunity to stay informed. To submit your question, use the hashtag #AskAbbott on social media.
 
You can watch the town hall on any of the 14 Nexstar stations across the state, or via live-stream online.
Hosting a televised virtual town hall meeting tonight at 7PM CT with @TDEM, @TexasDSHS, and @teainfo to answer questions and discuss what the state is doing to mitigate the spread of #COVID19.

Texas is committed to supporting businesses & employees affected by #COVID19. Restaurants with a permit may now deliver alcoholic beverages with food purchases; alcohol distributors & manufacturers may buy back excess inventory.

State and local leaders in Texas have one collective goal: to slow the spread of #COVID19. The insight of community leaders is vital as we continue to work together to protect public health and follow CDC guidelines.

Announcing the Texas Students MealFinder Map alongside @teainfo.

This searchable online map will help parents locate facilities serving meals in their communities while schools are temporarily closed.

Suspending provisions of the Texas Election Code to allow political subdivisions to postpone their 2020 local elections.

This means local governments now have the ability to postpone their May 2, 2020 elections until November 3, 2020.
Expanding telemedicine options will help doctors across Texas continue to treat their patients while mitigating the spread of COVID-19.
Today I requested a designation from @SBAgov to allow Texas small businesses to apply for low-interest Economic Injury Disaster Loans to help provide relief from the costly impact of #COVID19.

Joined hospital CEOs and representatives for a video call today to discuss care capacities for #COVID19.
 
Texas is working closely with hospital networks & administrators to ensure they have the resources and capabilities to respond to this virus.

Waiving certain vehicle registration, titling, and parking placard regulations in Texas. 

TX continues to implement a comprehensive plan to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 – including strategies to reduce preventable in-person contact.
Texas is maintaining government transparency and operations while reducing face-to-face contact for government open meetings.

Expanding #COVID19 testing capabilities throughout Texas is a top priority. I appreciate our San Antonio partners for their leadership in establishing the first drive-through testing site. Together, we will protect the health & safety of our communities.

STAAR testing requirements have been waived for the 2019-2020 school year.

We will continue to empower schools to make the best decisions to protect their communities from COVID-19.
Allowing trucks from the alcohol industry to deliver grocery supplies provides grocers with another private-sector option to keep their shelves stocked.
The Texas Medical Board & the Texas Board of Nursing are fast-tracking temporary licensing for certain out-of-state medical professionals.

Waiving certain regulations related to commercial trucking in TX to expedite delivery of resources around the state.

This ensures grocers and retailers can continually stock shelves. Texans should note stockpiling is not necessary.

Providing an update with @TDEM and @TexasDSHS on TX’s response to #COVID19.
 
TX is prepared, and we continue to take proactive measures along with the support of our federal and local partners to contain this virus and keep Texans safe. 

More info:

Updating legislators, mayors & county judges on TX's ongoing #COVID19 efforts.

Local jurisdictions are crucial to protecting public health, & state agencies remain in constant contact with local leaders to provide additional resources & up to date info.
